{"step_by_step_thinking": "Adrenaline is commonly used in surgeries to control bleeding. However, it can have side effects. Document [17] also mentions that systemic absorption of locally injected vasoconstrictors like adrenaline occurs, causing temporary hypotension and other hemodynamic changes. Document [18] reports a case where a young male died because of intraventricular bleeding caused by adrenaline infiltration during rhinoplasty.
